text: In my JSP, I have the following include for a header with breadcrumbs: Since each JSP can be n-levels deep in my URL hierarchy, I just pass in as many parameters called "breadcrumb" as I am deep (like directories in a file system). In the included header.jsp, I then request all the parameter values as follows: String[] breadcrumbs = request.getParameterValues( "breadcrumb" ); This worked great in Tomcat4.0b1, but now it only returns an array of length one with only the last value of the breadcrumb parameter (in this case "List"). Thanks for you help, Larry Karnowski larry@opennms.org www.opennms.org
creator: larry@opennms.org

text:
Your first "breadcrumb" parameter value contains characters that need to be
encoded. If you passed simple strings as the "breadcrumb" values then you would
see the array of parameter values.

The HTTP specification goes over what characters should be encoded and how to
encode them.

One simple solution is to use a custom tag to do the encoding for you. JSR 052,
the Standard Taglibs, is working on a utility tag that will do the encoding as
well as other format tags. The current JSR 052 tag library, called "jsptl", can
be found at http://jakarta.apache.org/taglibs
